{{also|Seit|šeit}} ==Finnish== ===Noun=== {{head|fi|noun form}} # {{fi-form of|sei|case=nominative|pl=plural}} ===Anagrams=== * {{anagrams|fi|a=eist|-itse|esti|etsi|itse|itse-|ties}} ---- ==German== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|gmh|sīt}}, from {{inh|de|goh|sīd}}, from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*sīþaz}}. Akin to {{cog|osx|sīd}}. Compare obsolete English {{m|en|sith}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{audio|de|De-seid.ogg|audio}} * {{IPA|de|/zaɪ̯t/}} * {{audio|de|De-seit.ogg|Audio}} * {{homophones|de|seid}} ===Conjunction=== {{head|de|conjunction}} # [[since]] #* '''1918''', [[w:de:Elisabeth von Heyking|Elisabeth von Heyking]], ''[[s:de:Aus dem Lande der Ostseeritter|Aus dem Lande der Ostseeritter]]'', in ''Zwei Erzählungen'', Phillipp Reclam jun., page 106: #*: Vierzig mal 365 Tage und dazu noch die Schalttage waren verstrichen, '''seit''' Dorothee unter den Apfelbäumen Burkahnens über ihr Leben entschieden hatte. #*:: Forty times 365 days and in addition the leap days had passed since Dorothee had decided her future life under the apple trees of Burkahnen. ====Usage notes==== * ''Seit'' is often construed with the present tense in clauses defining the age a person was when something began: ''seit ich klein bin'' (“since I was little”), ''seit ich ein Kind bin'' (“since I was a child”). This use of the present tense is somewhat peculiar but mirrors the present tense in the main clause: ''Ich tanze schon, seit ich klein bin.'' (“I’ve danced since I was little.”) The past tense is equally possible and common, however (thus: ''seit ich klein war''). * The present tense for still continuing states, as in ''seit ich hier arbeite'' (“since I’ve been working here”), is not anomalous but according to the general rules. ===Preposition=== {{head|de|preposition|+ dative}} # [[since]] # [[for]] ---- ==Middle Dutch== ===Verb=== {{head|dum|verb form}} # {{inflection of|dum|seggen||3|s|pres|indc}} ---- ==Romansch== ===Alternative forms=== * {{qualifier|Rumantsch Grischun|Puter|Vallader}} {{l|rm|said}} * {{qualifier|Sutsilvan}} {{l|rm|set}} * {{qualifier|Surmiran}} {{l|rm|seid}} ===Etymology=== From {{etyl|la|rm}} {{m|la|sitis}}, from {{etyl|ine-pro|rm}} {{m|ine-pro|*dʰgʷʰítis||perishing, decrease}}. ===Noun=== {{head|rm|noun|g=f}} # {{lb|rm|Sursilvan}} [[thirst]]
